page.title: 17Basketry Classes
page.content: Mrs. Harding took up basketry 11 years ago. She learnt the craft at The Country Centre in Cambridge and first did it purely as a hobby. Then she started a basketry group in Fen Ditton Church Hall on Thursdays from 2.00 to 4.30. The people who come are mainly women who no longer have young children. Several of the members are grandmothers. Some of the members pick up the skills quickly, others take quite a long time. The group use rushes to make table mats and willow to make baskets.The baskets may be made for carrying logs, apples or eggs and very small ones are made for salt cellars and pepper pots.They buy the materials already prepared for use.They only need three tools,secateurs, a sharp spike and a Stanley knife.
